Caster.synopsis: This unimportant Fist is checking the barracks inventory. Doesn't want to be bothered. Another Fist named Mirek has disappeared/left and she is now in charge of keeping track of the supplies. Turns out Mirek did a pretty poor job.
Caster.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, talk to the NPC

Corporal.synopsis: One-liner dialog for the Flaming Fist drill master corporal overseeing the sparing between the two privates at the training grounds at the barracks near the Basilisk Gate.

CrimeComplainer002.synopsis: Random dwarf female complains about crime in the city. Her husband was beaten up recently. Reacts to player's current health and relates to them if hurt.
CrimeComplainer002.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, talk to the female dwarf NPC

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard.synopsis: Fist Murphy is being punished for stealing a purse full of coin from the evidence room. He's being made to stand on one leg as punishment. Fist Clover occasionally comes to check up on him. Murphy is mortified, sore, and wishes the punishment was over. Clover has sympathy for him but also thinks he was a big dumb idiot.
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, observe the NPC

CrimeComplainer003_AD.synopsis: A female human at the Basilisk Gate mumbles to herself,  lamenting about the fact that she blindly bought a house that neighbors the infamous Blushing Mermaid, a criminal den. She loops through 4 pools of randomly selected one liners.
CrimeComplainer003_AD.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, observe the human civilian at the Flaming Fists barracks  yard

Private02_AD.synopsis: 2 Fists got an extreme training as a form of punisment. A commander is observing them. This is the equivalent of "drop and give me twenty" except she wants like twenty thousand. From time to time the 2 Fists get weakened, as they are on the brink of exhaustion, and say a random line from this pool. Alll lines involve heavy panting.
Private02_AD.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, observe the NPC

CrimeComplainer001.synopsis: Complaining about crime in the city. Random dwarf male.
CrimeComplainer001.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, talk to the NPC

MissingKidsMother_CommanderUnavailable.synopsis: Edge-case one-liner for missing kid's mother in case for some reason Commander is not available for their group dialogue
MissingKidsMother_CommanderUnavailable.how_to_trigger: Talk with missing kid's mother with Commander not being available for the dialogue, 158.981; 51.441; -15.128

Executioner.synopsis: This is a Flaming fist standing on the gallows in lower city. He says that all the cultists, thieves, marauders and troublemakers will be hanged, no doubt about it. He is quite dedicated and brutal about it.

CrimeComplainer003.synopsis: Random human female complains about crime in the city. Her house neighbors the infamous Blushing Mermaid and receives damage from the regular pubfights there.
CrimeComplainer003.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, talk to the female human civilian

AD_Combat_Commander_001.how_to_trigger: Fight S_LOW_BasiliskGate_Commander. AD triggered when taking a turn

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD.synopsis: Two dwarves periodically discuss the crime in the city of Baldur's Gate.
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, observe the dwarves

Private01.synopsis: One-liner dialog for one of the Flaming Fist privates sparring at the training grounds at the barracks near the Basilisk Gate.

GateGuard.synopsis: This Fist is standing guard at the gate that leads to basilisk gate barracks. He is balancing on one leg as punishment for stealing something from the evidence room. His right leg is raised.
GateGuard.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, talk to the NPC

Corporal_AD.synopsis: This commander is observing the sparring of 2 other Fists. She is furious at their performance and is roaring at them in typical drill sergeant fashion.
Corporal_AD.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, observe the NPC

ExecutionGuard_01.synopsis: This guards gets spawned along with Counselor Florrick's executed body to keep an eye on it. They might have been part of the execution. Unlike their colleague this one doesn't question the orders and is completely on board with the propaganda messaging.
ExecutionGuard_01.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_BasiliskGate_FlorrickHangedSpot_343dfb1c-7175-42c6-bca7-dc53cc46c617, set flag LOW_BasiliskGate_State_FlorrickExecutionKnown_aff10649-cfc1-b6d0-0984-5572383cda0a, longrest several times (currently 5x) unitl Florrick gets executed. This guard is spawned on the gallows. Talk to them.

AD_Combat_Commander_002.how_to_trigger: Fight S_LOW_BasiliskGate_Commander. AD triggered when taking a turn

Sergeant.synopsis: One-liner dialog for one of the idling Flaming Fist officers at the barracks near the Basilisk Gate.

AD_Executioner.synopsis: This is a Flaming fist standing on the gallows in lower city. He says that all the cultists, thieves, marauders and troublemakers will be hanged, no doubt about it. He is more of herald in fact.

AD_MotherBegsCommander.synopsis: When players enter Basilisk Gate building (not prison!), they overhear this AD-conversation between Commander Liara and hag-kidnapped kid's mother. Mother begs commander to investigate the kid disappearence in Blushing Mermaid, but the commander is reluctant to do so
AD_MotherBegsCommander.how_to_trigger: Enter Basilisk Gate building (not prison!) and come up to one of the NPCs, 158.981; 51.441; -15.128

Private02.synopsis: One-liner dialog for one of the Flaming Fist privates sparring at the training grounds at the barracks near the Basilisk Gate.

Sentinel.synopsis: A Fist at Basilisk's gate - she is unusual for the Fist in that she's more casual and little flirty (there's a reason she's been confined to up patrolling up top).
Sentinel.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, talk to NPC

Private01_AD.synopsis: 2 Fists got an extreme training as a form of punisment. A commander is observing them. This is the equivalent of "drop and give me twenty" except she wants like twenty thousand. From time to time the 2 Fists get weakened, as they are on the brink of exhaustion, and say a random line from this pool. Alll lines involve heavy panting.
Private01_AD.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, observe the NPC

DoorGuard.synopsis: This random Fist is standing by the door to Flaming Fist HQ. As opposed to the shame spot at the gate this is an honor spot basically employee of the moth reward. He has some reactions to execution of Florrick. Turns out he's extremely lawful.. and awful.
DoorGuard.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, talk to the NPC

AD_Combat_Commander_000.how_to_trigger: Fight S_LOW_BasiliskGate_Commander. AD triggered when taking a turn

CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD.synopsis: Crime complainer occasionaly goes to the Flamist Fist Manip to see if they're any update on his case. He's been mugged twice in the last month and is scared anf frustrated. The Manip and the Fist are stretched thin but she's trying to maintain some formality.
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, observe the dwarves

Commander.how_to_trigger: Click on Cmmander with the mother not available for dialogue, 160.29; 51.441; -15.193

Caster_AD.synopsis: This unimportant Fist is checking the barracks inventory. Doesn't want to be bothered. She is trying to organise a very messy inventory.
Caster_AD.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_Prison_Door_TeleportTo_6be6fb14-3920-4765-b2db-ce2f34b5246b, observe the NPC

Cook.synopsis: One-liner dialog for a cook at the Flaming Fist barracks near Basilisk Gate.

ExecutionGuard_02.synopsis: This guards gets spawned along with Counselor Florrick's executed body to keep an eye on it. Clearly didn't approve of the execution.
ExecutionGuard_02.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_BasiliskGate_FlorrickHangedSpot_343dfb1c-7175-42c6-bca7-dc53cc46c617, set flag LOW_BasiliskGate_State_FlorrickExecutionKnown_aff10649-cfc1-b6d0-0984-5572383cda0a, longrest several times (currently 5x) unitl Florrick gets executed. This guard is spawned on the gallows. Talk to them.

MissingKidsMother_Commader.synopsis: Interactive dialogue with both Commander and mother. Mother asks players to look for her kid while the commander is obviously confused and doesn't want to investigate the case for some reason
MissingKidsMother_Commader.how_to_trigger: Talk to either commander or mother with both of them available for dialogue, 160.29; 51.441; -15.193

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD.synopsis: All lines here should be short!Several posters can be found across the city announcing the impending execution of Florrick. With every longrest taken ever since the player party KNOWS about the execution we count down 1 day. When any poster is destroyed the funny addendum line is played as well. When the execution is bound to happen next day a rnadom party member reacts ONCE. Poster are gone when the execution happened. The posters claim the xecution is "postponed" when Florrick is saved from the prison.
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_A, LOW, teleport to S_LOW_BasiliskGate_FlorrickHangedSpot_343dfb1c-7175-42c6-bca7-dc53cc46c617, Interact with with any execution poster

Caster_0.speaker: Fist Eostre
Caster_0.text: If you have a problem, speak to one of the other Fist. A rabid worg organised this inventory, judging by the mess they've left me.
Caster_0.context: NodeContext: a little bursque, but because they're stressed

Caster_1.speaker: Fist Eostre
Caster_1.text: Not now. I'm trying to figure out what type of villain puts oranges and onions in the same box.
Caster_1.context: NodeContext: a little bursque, but because they're stressed

Corporal_1.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_1.text: The youngsters are upset about the death of Lord Gortash - they looked up to him. Saps. Leaders come and leaders go, but the Flaming Fist is still here.

Corporal_3.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_3.text: You should join up with the Flaming Fist. Tired of coddling these witless wimps.

Corporal_4.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_4.text: I like the look of you - you can clearly hold your own. Tell me, if you had two wimps who slept through their shifts, what would you do?
Corporal_4.context: NodeContext: admiration - seeking the advice from one warrior to another

Corporal_0.speaker: Player
Corporal_0.text: Exactly what you're doing - push them until they collapse.

Corporal_10.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_10.text: Glad to know I've still got it. Let's see if we're both right.

Corporal_9.speaker: Player
Corporal_9.text: Double their shifts and dock their pay.

Corporal_7.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_7.text: Oh, now that's an idea. If I hear one more whine out of them, I might just do that - thanks.

Corporal_2.speaker: Player
Corporal_2.text: Let it slide - just this once.

Corporal_8.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_8.text: Hmm. I see you and I have two very different views on discipline.

Corporal_5.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_5.text: Excuse me - I've got blackguards to whip into shape. YOU CALL THAT A STRIKE?
Corporal_5.context: NodeContext: little distracted, then turns away from player and roars at her two underlings  (could be to her left or right depending on which direction player has approached her from)

Corporal_6.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_6.text: I like your look - you've seen battle, shed some blood. Could show these softies here how it's done.

CrimeComplainer002_1.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainer002_1.text: We're too poor to leave. But too scared to stay - like half the city.

CrimeComplainer002_3.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainer002_3.text: The thugs are getting bolder. My husband's been mugged twice this month, if you can believe it.

CrimeComplainer002_0.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainer002_0.text: Oh darling - you've been hurt too? Shame what this city's come to.

CrimeComplainer002_2.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainer002_2.text: You be safe out there. Can't trust a damn soul.

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_1.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_1.text: All right, Murphy, five more minutes and your punishment is over.

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_3.speaker: Fist Murphy
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_3.text: I'm getting off easy? What happened, has the Blaze gone soft?

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_11.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_11.text: Not likely. Lord Gortash has been killed, so it's all hands on deck. Punishment duty can wait.

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_4.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_4.text: I'm impressed. I fell on my arse the first time Blaze Portyr made me do that.

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_7.speaker: Fist Murphy
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_7.text: Does that mean I can put my leg down?

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_14.speaker: Fist Murphy
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_14.text: Can I put my leg down yet?

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_10.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_10.text: Nope - you're still in Blaze Portyr's bad books.

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_5.speaker: Fist Murphy
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_5.text: But I - I can't feel my leg!

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_8.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_8.text: You stole coin, you dingus. What did you expect would happen?

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_15.speaker: Fist Murphy
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_15.text: Here to yell at me, I presume?

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_2.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_2.text: I came to check on you. How are you holding up?

Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_12.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_AD_WithGateGuard_12.text: Liar. I'll see about sneaking you some lunch.

CrimeComplainer003_AD_0.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_AD_0.text: The city's grubbiest tavern, and I had to move next to it.

CrimeComplainer003_AD_1.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_AD_1.text: Nothing but scammers - and the scammed.

CrimeComplainer003_AD_2.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_AD_2.text: Disgraceful. Is this what Baldur's Gate is coming to?

CrimeComplainer003_AD_3.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_AD_3.text: Criminals of all sorts. This place is damned near overrun.

Private02_AD_0.speaker: Fist Crosse
Private02_AD_0.context: NodeContext: The characters are exhausted from physical exrcise. They should be panitng heavily.

CrimeComplainer001_0.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainer001_0.text: If you're here to report something, don't bother - the Fist don't give a damn.

CrimeComplainer001_1.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainer001_1.text: I don't leave my house now without a blade - the hell is this city coming to?

CrimeComplainer001_2.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainer001_2.text: I don't leave my house now without a blade in case - wait. Where's my dagger?! Gods damn it, do thieves have no shame?

MissingKidsMother_CommanderUnavailable_0.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_CommanderUnavailable_0.context: NodeContext: MAD - yelling out looking for the commander

MissingKidsMother_CommanderUnavailable_1.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_CommanderUnavailable_1.text: You here for Portyr too? She sent me a panicked message and then doesn't even have the decency to speak to me?! Rude.

Executioner_1.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_1.text: Cultists, murderers, pickpockets - doesn't matter what you do. All you lot will end up swinging from here.

Executioner_2.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_2.text: Spread the word - the traitor Florrick is dead! May she be the first of the scrum we purge from Baldur's Gate.

Executioner_4.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_4.text: Unless you want to end up swinging like Florrick, you'll move along.

Executioner_11.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_11.text: Do I look in the mood for natter? Lord Gortash is dead - and so is any chance this city had at a future. Damn it all.

Executioner_14.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_14.text: Eyes front and keep your nose clean, newcomer - a noose and a short drop is how we deal with troublemakers.
Executioner_14.context: NodeContext: very policeman giving a lecture

Executioner_13.speaker: Player
Executioner_13.text: How about you wait until I commit a crime before threatening me?

Executioner_0.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_0.text: By then it will be too late. I can't help the dead - but I can warn the living.
Executioner_0.context: NodeContext: a shrug, he genuinely thinks he's helping

Executioner_3.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_3.text: Stay the path, and obey the law - and you have nothing to fear.
Executioner_3.context: NodeContext: guinely thinks he's being helpful

Executioner_8.speaker: Player
Executioner_8.text: Careful - a big guy like you makes for an easy target.

Executioner_16.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_16.text: Careful - that sounds like a threat. And people who threaten the Fist end up in jail - or dead.

Executioner_7.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_7.text: Now run along - before I start taking you seriously.

Executioner_15.speaker: Player
Executioner_15.text: There's a notice here announcing the execution of Counsellor Florrick. What's that about?

Executioner_10.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_10.text: The witch is a traitor - turned her back on the Flaming Fist, the very people who raised her up!

Executioner_12.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_12.text: She's being kept in Wyrm's Rock.

Executioner_5.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
Executioner_5.text: Good. Now move along before I charge you with loitering.

CrimeComplainer003_9.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_9.text: About time. The manip assured me a builder would come around a tenday ago, and -

CrimeComplainer003_8.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_8.text: Hold it. You're not the builder. Which means I've got no use for you.

CrimeComplainer003_13.speaker: Player
CrimeComplainer003_13.text: Is everyone in the neighbourhood as friendly as you?

CrimeComplainer003_1.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_1.text: Look here, chum. To get by in this place, you've got to be tough as tacks.

CrimeComplainer003_0.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_0.text: There's no winning over the hooligans at the Blushing Mermaid with a smile and a nice 'hello'.

CrimeComplainer003_7.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_7.text: Now either you learn to fix my broken shutters, or you wag your tongue elsewhere.

CrimeComplainer003_3.speaker: Player
CrimeComplainer003_3.text: Why do you need a carpenter so badly?

CrimeComplainer003_10.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_10.text: Hooligans at the Mermaid've been using my shutters for target practise.

CrimeComplainer003_17.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_17.text: And that's not the half of it. I've had to replace the same window three times now, not to mention the mess they've made of my front door.

CrimeComplainer003_6.speaker: Player
CrimeComplainer003_6.text: No, but I'm handy still with a hammer and chisel.

CrimeComplainer003_16.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_16.text: *Scoff.* I need someone with a little more know-how.

CrimeComplainer003_2.speaker: Player
CrimeComplainer003_2.text: Oh but I am a builder - a builder of faith.

CrimeComplainer003_5.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_5.text: Oh are you? Tell me, where was your god when those hooligans were kicking in my shutters, eh?

CrimeComplainer003_11.speaker: Thrastle Muria
CrimeComplainer003_11.text: Curse those vandals at the Mermaid. Haven't had a wink of sleep for days.

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_1.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_1.text: How's your head? That last mugger left a hell of a mark.

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_8.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_8.text: Har-har. We can come back another time, if you ain't feeling up to it?
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_8.context: NodeContext: Har har har - sarcastic. ('Yeah, you're REAL funny, aren't you?')

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_5.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_5.text: Nah, let's see what Portyr has to say - she claimed she'd look into it.

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_4.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_4.text: There's more Flaming Fist on the streets than ever - maybe they'll whip the place into shape.

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_3.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_3.text: Nah. They're too busy 'visiting' Mamzell's guys and gals.

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_2.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_2.text: They do that quite a bit, don't they? It's a shame.

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_7.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_7.text: Ravengard's back, I heard. Bet he'll twist some arms, clean up the riffraff.

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_0.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_0.text: Duke-types don't care what goes on in our streets.

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_10.speaker: Bruha Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_10.text: Ravengard's no upper-crust softie. He's in charge of the Fist, right?

CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_11.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainers001_002_AD_11.text: If Ravengard had trained the Fist proper, they'd be out catching crooks, not turning a blind eye.

Private01_0.speaker: Fist Koltz
Private01_0.text: I just need a moment, catch my breath...
Private01_0.context: NodeContext: He's very tired from drills.

Private01_1.speaker: Fist Koltz
Private01_1.text: I am never. Sleeping on duty. Again.
Private01_1.context: NodeContext: The Gauntlet is his drillmaster. Panting, exhausted

GateGuard_3.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_3.text: I can't believe it - they actually executed Counsellor Florrick. I didn't know a person could turn so... purple.

GateGuard_11.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_11.text: Don't distract me! It's all I can do to stay balanced.

GateGuard_0.speaker: Player
GateGuard_0.text: Is this one of Blaze Portyr's infamous punishments?

GateGuard_9.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_9.text: Yes. I... stole a purse from the evidence room. It was stupid, and I swore to Blaze Portyr I'd never do it again! Ever.
GateGuard_9.context: NodeContext: clearly embarssed and very apologetic

GateGuard_26.speaker: Player
GateGuard_26.text: Why are you standing on one leg?

GateGuard_4.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_4.text: I... stole a purse from the evidence room. It was stupid, and I swore to Blaze Portyr I'd never do it again! Ever.
GateGuard_4.context: NodeContext: clearly embarssed and very apologetic

GateGuard_12.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_12.text: I have to stand on one leg until she believes me.

GateGuard_18.speaker: Player
GateGuard_18.text: How long is that going to take?

GateGuard_24.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_24.text: That's not funny! If I fall, I have to start all over.

GateGuard_6.speaker: Player
GateGuard_6.text: You're a Flaming Fist - how dare you steal from the people you're supposed to protect?!

GateGuard_8.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_8.text: I'm sorry, all right! It was the spur of the moment, and I'm sorry.

GateGuard_10.speaker: Player
GateGuard_10.text: If you were truly sorry, you would be working night and day. You would be willing to die for forgiveness.

GateGuard_13.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_13.text: It - it was just a purse, mate. Bloody hells, you make Blaze Portyr look like a softie.
GateGuard_13.context: NodeContext: shocked at player's outburst, grumbling to himself at last line

GateGuard_14.speaker: Player
GateGuard_14.text: Were I your master I would  make you cut off your own hand. Be grateful to this Portyr.

GateGuard_17.speaker: Player
GateGuard_17.text: Such blind obedience. Stand up to this Portyr - prove to her that you are not a weakling.

GateGuard_1.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_1.text: Are you kidding? This is Blaze Portyr - the leader of the Flaming Fist! She once crushed a man's skull with her bare hand.
GateGuard_1.context: NodeContext: clearly scared of his leader and the very thought of standing up to her

GateGuard_27.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_27.text: I can't, all right? I just can't.
GateGuard_27.context: NodeContext: clearly scared of his leader and the very thought of standing up to her

GateGuard_21.speaker: Player
GateGuard_21.text: A valuable discipline for a guard! Centre yourself on nothingness.

GateGuard_23.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_23.text: Tempus help me, a monk! Could you please take a vow of silence until I'm done here? You know, so I can centre myself.

GateGuard_20.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_20.text: Suddenly being made to stand on one foot for hours doesn't seem like such a bad punishment.

GateGuard_25.speaker: Fist Murphy
GateGuard_25.text: Shh. I just have to last... a little longer.

Corporal_AD_0.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_AD_0.text: Ten bouts for every minute you were snoozing - PICK IT UP!

Corporal_AD_1.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_AD_1.text: Nap on duty again, soldiers, and this will look like a damned holiday.

Corporal_AD_2.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_AD_2.text: Think of this next time you fancy a NAP on duty!

Corporal_AD_3.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_AD_3.text: Tighten up, you armoured puppies. With Lord Gortash dead, you need to look alive and act smart - as smart as a pack of puppies can, anyway.

Corporal_AD_4.speaker: Gauntlet Thunder
Corporal_AD_4.text: You call that a strike? My grandmother could do better!

ExecutionGuard_01_0.speaker: Fist Williams
ExecutionGuard_01_0.text: Look at the body all you like - it'll be up for a while as a 'reminder'.
ExecutionGuard_01_0.context: NodeContext: clearly agrees with the execution

ExecutionGuard_01_1.speaker: Fist Williams
ExecutionGuard_01_1.text: How long am I supposed to guard some stiff - ah hells.
ExecutionGuard_01_1.context: NodeContext: annoyed, wants to go home when he notices the body is gone. Shocked

ExecutionGuard_01_2.speaker: Fist Williams
ExecutionGuard_01_2.text: What sicko takes a corpse? Damn it all!
ExecutionGuard_01_2.context: NodeContext: angry, slightly distraught, knows he'll likely be fired for this

ExecutionGuard_01_3.speaker: Fist Williams
ExecutionGuard_01_3.text: Can you believe it? Florrick - a traitor to her own. Good riddance, I say.

AD_Combat_Commander_002_0.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
AD_Combat_Commander_002_0.text: The Flaming Fist will not fall to the likes of you!

Sergeant_0.speaker: Manip Seyama
Sergeant_0.text: Your tools were stolen, right? No - you were mugged! Wait, I'm mixing you up with another citizen. I'm terribly sorry, I'll - I'll get back to you.
Sergeant_0.context: NodeContext: frazzled, doing her best to keep everyone happy

Sergeant_1.speaker: Manip Seyama
Sergeant_1.text: I'm doing my utmost to get through these crime reports. I'll be with you as soon as I can!
Sergeant_1.context: NodeContext: frazzled, doing her best to keep everyone happy

Sergeant_2.speaker: Manip Seyama
Sergeant_2.text: Come back another day, citizen. Due to Lord Gortash's death, state security matters take precedence over routine crime reports. Now move along.

Sergeant_3.speaker: Manip Seyama
Sergeant_3.text: Blaze Portyr is perfectly fine, she's simply, ah, under tremendous pressure. There's nothing to worry about.
Sergeant_3.context: NodeContext: knows her commander is acting weird but has no idea why - trying to cover for her

Sergeant_4.speaker: Manip Seyama
Sergeant_4.text: I'm afraid I have a dozen crime reports to organise - kindly wait outside.
Sergeant_4.context: NodeContext: frazzled, doing her best to keep everyone happy

AD_Executioner_0.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
AD_Executioner_0.text: Remember - the Flaming Fist are here for your protection.
AD_Executioner_0.context: NodeContext: calling out from the gallows. Heartfelt, genuine

AD_Executioner_1.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
AD_Executioner_1.text: But should you threaten that order, we will not hesitate to strike you down.

AD_Executioner_2.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
AD_Executioner_2.text: So heed my words, troublemakers and wrongdoers - the Flaming Fist are coming for you.

AD_Executioner_6.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
AD_Executioner_6.text: Keep a wide berth of the gallows, please - for your own safety.
AD_Executioner_6.context: NodeContext: calling out from the gallows. Heartfelt, genuine

AD_Executioner_4.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
AD_Executioner_4.text: Interference with Flaming Fist property will be dealt with swiftly and harshly.

AD_Executioner_7.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
AD_Executioner_7.text: Do not fear the gallows! It is here to serve you - the people of Baldur's Gate.
AD_Executioner_7.context: NodeContext: calling out from the gallows. Heartfelt, genuine

AD_Executioner_3.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
AD_Executioner_3.text: Every criminal we hang is one less stain on the peace and prosperity of this great city.

AD_Executioner_5.speaker: Fist 'Edge' Arensen
AD_Executioner_5.text: Stay the path and obey the law, and you all have nothing to fear.

AD_MotherBegsCommander_0.speaker: Lora
AD_MotherBegsCommander_0.text: You asked me to come here! Don't you remember?
AD_MotherBegsCommander_0.context: NodeContext: annoyed and scared for her daughter

AD_MotherBegsCommander_5.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
AD_MotherBegsCommander_5.text: Yes - I mean, no. I mean...
AD_MotherBegsCommander_5.context: NodeContext: wincing in pain - trying to remember who vanra is, but can't (she's been hexed)

AD_MotherBegsCommander_11.speaker: Lora
AD_MotherBegsCommander_11.text: Are you drunk? Is that what this is?

AD_MotherBegsCommander_12.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
AD_MotherBegsCommander_12.text: Of course not! Simply tell me why you're here.

AD_MotherBegsCommander_2.speaker: Lora
AD_MotherBegsCommander_2.text: I've told you about eight times now.
AD_MotherBegsCommander_2.context: NodeContext: frustrated, feels like she's going mad

AD_MotherBegsCommander_4.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
AD_MotherBegsCommander_4.context: NodeContext: wincing in pain - trying to remember who vanra is, but can't (she's been hexed)

AD_MotherBegsCommander_8.speaker: Lora
AD_MotherBegsCommander_8.context: NodeContext: annoyed and scared for her daughter

AD_MotherBegsCommander_10.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
AD_MotherBegsCommander_10.text: Forgive me - what was her name?
AD_MotherBegsCommander_10.context: NodeContext: wincing in pain - trying to remember who vanra is, but can't (she's been hexed)

AD_MotherBegsCommander_3.speaker: Lora
AD_MotherBegsCommander_3.context: NodeContext: Scared for her missing child, frustrated with the officer she's speaking to

AD_MotherBegsCommander_1.speaker: Lora
AD_MotherBegsCommander_1.text: Have you even bothered looking for her?
AD_MotherBegsCommander_1.context: NodeContext: annoyed and scared for her daughter

AD_MotherBegsCommander_6.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
AD_MotherBegsCommander_6.context: NodeContext: wincing in pain - trying to remember who vanra is, but can't (she's been hexed)

AD_MotherBegsCommander_7.speaker: Lora
AD_MotherBegsCommander_7.context: NodeContext: annoyed and scared for her daughter

Private02_0.speaker: Fist Crosse
Private02_0.text: 'Put all your weight in it', she says. But I can't give more than I've got.
Private02_0.context: NodeContext: Training as hard as he can but the drillmaster still thinks he's weak.

Private02_1.speaker: Fist Crosse
Private02_1.text: Distract the Gauntlet will you? I think she's set on killing me.
Private02_1.context: NodeContext: Training as hard as he can but the drillmaster still thinks he's weak.

Sentinel_0.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_0.text: Well, hello. I've never seen anyone as interesting as yourself. Behave, yeah? I'd hate to see someone as pretty as you in cuffs.
Sentinel_0.context: NodeContext: character is a beastial race of some sorts - she's never seen one but is intrigued

Sentinel_1.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_1.text: Hey, good-looking. Behave yourself, yeah? I'd hate to see someone as pretty as you in cuffs.

Sentinel_2.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_2.text: Well, hello. We don't get too many visitors from down below. Behave, yeah? I'd hate to see someone as pretty as you in cuffs.
Sentinel_2.context: NodeContext: player is from the underdark - she is surprised but also flirty

Sentinel_3.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_3.text: Try not to get into trouble... too much trouble, at least.

Sentinel_4.speaker: Fist Clover
Sentinel_4.text: Your arms are like tree trunks - they're amazing! Kindly behave yourself while you're here, yeah? I don't fancy my chances if I have to tackle you.
Sentinel_4.context: NodeContext: Impressed, appreciative, a little flirty

Private01_AD_0.speaker: Fist Koltz
Private01_AD_0.context: NodeContext: The characters are exhausted from physical exrcise. They should be panitng heavily.

DoorGuard_1.speaker: Fist Miller
DoorGuard_1.text: Justice is swift and severe in Baldur's Gate - as it should be.

DoorGuard_3.speaker: Fist Miller
DoorGuard_3.text: A half-orc? Hmm. Keep your head down and your fists to yourself, and we won't have any problems.
DoorGuard_3.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed, racist dick about half orcs (thinks they're violent)

DoorGuard_4.speaker: Fist Miller
DoorGuard_4.text: First they took Duke Stelmane, now they've taken Lord Gortash. Count on it - the Flaming Fist will make those Absolute bastards pay.

DoorGuard_6.speaker: Fist Miller
DoorGuard_6.text: Keep crime reports short - do not waste our time with frivolous issues.

DoorGuard_10.speaker: Fist Miller
DoorGuard_10.text: Take heed, citizen - the traitor Florrick swings in the square. She won't be missed.

DoorGuard_5.speaker: Fist Miller
DoorGuard_5.text: Sympathisers have no place in the city - you'd do well to remember that.

DoorGuard_7.speaker: Fist Miller
DoorGuard_7.context: NodeContext: 'order before all' is like the fist 'protect and serve'. It's both a farewell and a warning not to step out of line

DoorGuard_8.speaker: Player
DoorGuard_8.text: That's a cruel way to talk about her.

AD_Combat_Commander_000_0.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
AD_Combat_Commander_000_0.text: I am Blaze Liara Portyr - and Baldur's Gate is under my protection.
AD_Combat_Commander_000_0.context: NodeContext: fierce, determined, ready to die for her city

CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_0.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_0.text: My wife and I have been waiting half the day - are you lot gonna help us or not?

CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_8.speaker: Manip Seyama
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_8.text: Take that tone with me again, and you'll see no one. You'll be called when you're called.

CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_1.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_1.text: Portyr herself said she was investigating my case?
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_1.context: NodeContext: alightly more annoyed, has been waiting for a while

CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_2.speaker: Manip Seyama
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_2.text: Blaze Portyr will get to you when she gets to you.
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_2.context: NodeContext: she's tired and exhausted, but doing her best to be polite but firm

CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_6.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_6.text: Oi - I've been mugged. I'm here about my case?
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_6.context: NodeContext: Little brusque and stern (he's been mugged before and wasn't impressed by the fist's attitude)

CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_3.speaker: Manip Seyama
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_3.text: We're dealing with an increased number of complaints, sir - please wait your turn.

CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_5.speaker: Thatmatt Oakhide
CrimeComplainer_001_CommanderAD_5.context: NodeContext: clearly a little unhappy with the answer but doesn't want to casue a fust

Commander_1.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
Commander_1.text: Commander Portyr, acting Marshal of the Fist. If you have a crime to report, please wait outside - we are currently at capacity.

Commander_2.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
Commander_2.text: I apologise for the hassle that woman caused. Such time-wasters and troublemakers are a plague on the Flaming Fist.
Commander_2.context: NodeContext: a touch frustrtaed, she wants to help as many people as she can but she's stretched thin

Commander_3.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
Commander_3.text: I have a city to protect, refugees to manage, and an army on my door - I do not have time to chat.

Commander_4.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
Commander_4.text: I have the strangest memory of a fey-like creature - perhaps I should rest before my next shift.
Commander_4.context: NodeContext: sore,  confused (the hag's curse has been lifted)

Commander_5.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
Commander_5.text: Forgive me, I have the most pounding of headaches. If you have any issues, one of my subordinates will see to you.
Commander_5.context: NodeContext: sore,  confused (the hag's curse has been lifted)

Caster_AD_0.speaker: Fist Eostre
Caster_AD_0.text: Wonder if I could freeze some supplies -  make them last longer.

Caster_AD_1.speaker: Fist Eostre
Caster_AD_1.text: Oh - the smell. Yep, that's gone bad.

Caster_AD_2.speaker: Fist Eostre
Caster_AD_2.text: The bread will go stale first so that should go to the front...

Cook_0.speaker: Cook Kameros
Cook_0.text: One of the men complained about hair in his stew. His hair!

Cook_1.speaker: Cook Kameros
Cook_1.text: Cooking as fast as I can. Those Fist have got bottomless bellies, I swear.

ExecutionGuard_02_0.speaker: Fist Anderson
ExecutionGuard_02_0.text: Hah - I'll be fired for this. No loss, considering I was quitting. Maybe this is a push from the gods.
ExecutionGuard_02_0.context: NodeContext: bitter laugh - considers it serendipity

ExecutionGuard_02_1.speaker: Fist Anderson
ExecutionGuard_02_1.text: I've met Counsellor Florrick - she didn't deserve this. Not one bit.
ExecutionGuard_02_1.context: NodeContext: bitter - clearly doesn't agree with the execution

ExecutionGuard_02_2.speaker: Fist Anderson
ExecutionGuard_02_2.text: Be glad you missed the execution. It's a mercy when their necks snap...
ExecutionGuard_02_2.context: NodeContext: bitter - clearly doesn't agree with the execution

ExecutionGuard_02_3.speaker: Fist Anderson
ExecutionGuard_02_3.text: This execution was a farce, Counsellor Florrick didn't - wait. Where's her body?!
ExecutionGuard_02_3.context: NodeContext: bitter - clearly doesn't agree with the execution, then noticing her body is gone

MissingKidsMother_Commader_12.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_12.text: My daughter's name is Vanra. We were in the Blushing Mermaid when she went missing.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_43.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_43.text: How many times do I need to say it? You sent word about a lead - said that I should come see you about it.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_43.context: NodeContext: confused, trying to reign in her temper (just about holding on)

MissingKidsMother_Commader_5.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_5.text: Of course, Madam, let me just... forgive me, why are you here?
MissingKidsMother_Commader_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: slight wince, like a small stab of painNodeContext: slight wince on ellipsises, as if she's in pain (she's been hexed by a hag and it's fucking with her memory)

MissingKidsMother_Commader_95.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_95.text: Is this some kind of sick joke? Do you have any idea what I've been through these past few days?

MissingKidsMother_Commader_33.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_33.text: You're Lora, right? And your child is missing?

MissingKidsMother_Commader_84.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_84.context: NodeContext: To player - relieved and desperate

MissingKidsMother_Commader_22.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_22.text: My daughter Vanra, my little girl, she's missing!

MissingKidsMother_Commader_87.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_87.text: Calm down - let the poor Flaming Fist alone.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_11.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_11.text: You try staying calm when your kid is missing!

MissingKidsMother_Commader_72.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_72.text: This stupid, useless Fist said she had a lead, but she must have been sucking dream mist or something.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_72.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, frustrated, feeling helpless (flaming fist is just in front of her)

MissingKidsMother_Commader_34.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_34.text: Madam, tell me... you said... she was... ah... taken from a tavern?
MissingKidsMother_Commader_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: wincing, like she's in pain, hand to headNodeContext: struggling to get the words out - the memory is there but she just can't reach it

MissingKidsMother_Commader_55.speaker: Narrator
MissingKidsMother_Commader_55.text: *You catch the barest tendrils of magic coiled around the Flaming Fist.*

MissingKidsMother_Commader_77.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_77.text: Yes. The Blushing. Mermaid. Down by the docks. I've told you a hundred times - why aren't you listening?
MissingKidsMother_Commader_77.context: NodeContext: nearly shouting - pissed off, frustrated

MissingKidsMother_Commader_0.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_0.text: A hag took her - I saw it with my own eyes.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_40.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_40.text: A hag has her? Gods above.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_42.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_42.text: What does a hag want with Vanra? My poor child...

MissingKidsMother_Commader_74.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_74.text: You have to do something - you have to save her. I have no one else. Please, help my little girl. Please.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_31.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_31.text: If you can pay me, I'll help you.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_16.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_16.text: Did you say your daughter's name is Vanra? I'm afraid she's dead.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_68.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_68.text: Is this some kind of bit you and the Fist are running? 'Cause it's not bloody funny. Vanra is lost - and these louts won't help me find her!

MissingKidsMother_Commader_46.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_46.text: She was eaten by a hag.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_76.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_76.text: What? You're serious? Vanra is... Vanra...

MissingKidsMother_Commader_81.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_81.text: I'm sorry, I did what I could to save her.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_89.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_89.text: Believe me or don't - your kid is still dead.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_47.speaker: Narrator
MissingKidsMother_Commader_47.text: *Someone, or something, has tampered with her memory.*

MissingKidsMother_Commader_86.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_86.text: What, ah, what were we discussing?
MissingKidsMother_Commader_86.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

MissingKidsMother_Commader_85.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_85.text: She's a typical Fist - they never listen.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_41.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_41.text: I am listening... now if you'll both calm down, this lady can tell me why she's here.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_41.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

MissingKidsMother_Commader_69.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_69.text: It's not very responsible to take a kid to a tavern.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_44.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_44.text: Don't you dare try to blame me. My daughter is gone!
MissingKidsMother_Commader_44.context: NodeContext: player has asked why she brought vanra to a tavern, defnesive, trying to change the subject (she got drunk when vanra was nabbed)

MissingKidsMother_Commader_24.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_24.text: Madam - do not raise your voice. Calm down, and tell me why you're here.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_24.context: NodeContext: confused, like you're coming out of a dream

MissingKidsMother_Commader_67.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_67.text: What is happening? I feel like I'm going mad.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_67.context: NodeContext: upset, hands in hair/head. Lost, feel like everyone knows what's happening but you

MissingKidsMother_Commader_66.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_66.text: I'm afraid it's too late - Vanra is dead.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_82.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_82.text: Have you searched for your daughter?

MissingKidsMother_Commader_29.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_29.text: Of course! I haven't stopped. I tore that tavern apart - the rooms, every nook and cranny I could think of. She's gone.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_29.context: NodeContext: defensive - she tore the place apart (and pulled a knife on a blushing mermaid staff memember when they tried to boot her)

MissingKidsMother_Commader_93.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_93.text: Someone's tampered with the Flaming Fist's memory.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_71.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_71.text: Nonsense. I'm fine. Madam, tell me why you're... urgh... here, and I will assist.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_71.context: NodeContext: surprised, then the moment she tries to address the missing child, wincing and in pain again (the hag hex)

MissingKidsMother_Commader_75.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_75.text: Gods, you're right. Something's wrong with her.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_32.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_32.text: Can you help me? I've no family, and Vanra's father isn't around. The Flaming Fist were my last resort.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_59.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_59.text: I'm so afraid. And so tired. I've been looking night and day, everywhere I could.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_59.context: NodeContext: the most vulnerable we've seen her

MissingKidsMother_Commader_60.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_60.text: I could help - for a price.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_7.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_7.text: I've got a little something stashed away - from a long time ago. You'll be paid, you have my word. Just find my little girl - please.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_70.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_70.text: Wait! Please at least look out for her - she's called Vanra, she's seven years old and has red hair - like me.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_70.context: NodeContext: player has tried to walk away, and she desperately stops them

MissingKidsMother_Commader_23.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_23.text: If you see her, just let me know. Please. I'll be at home - I'll get no help here.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_38.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_38.text: Someone has tampered with the Flaming Fist's memory - perhaps a hag?

MissingKidsMother_Commader_62.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_62.text: A hag? Preposterous! No such creature would dare set foot in the city.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_36.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_36.text: I think there's a hag in the city - this might be connected.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_73.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_73.text: A hag in Baldur's Gate? Preposterous.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_73.context: NodeContext: has actually met the hag, but it's been removed from her memory. Professionallty outraged

MissingKidsMother_Commader_15.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_15.text: Don't scare me more than I already am. What would a hag want with my Vanra? She's just lost, that's all!
MissingKidsMother_Commader_15.context: NodeContext: in very stiff denial, thinks the player is just trying to confuse her

MissingKidsMother_Commader_80.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_80.text: Gods, I'm so afraid. And so tired. I've been looking night and day, everywhere I could.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_80.context: NodeContext: the most vulnerable we've seen her

MissingKidsMother_Commader_53.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_53.text: I've no family, and Vanra's father isn't around. The Flaming Fist were my last resort.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_53.context: NodeContext: exhausted, feels like she's out of options

MissingKidsMother_Commader_57.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_57.text: I'll help you find your daughter.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_30.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_30.text: You will? Thank you - I haven't slept or eaten since she disappeared. I'm terrified something has happened to her.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_30.context: NodeContext: grateful (in her world, people don't help other people), exhausted, vulnerable

MissingKidsMother_Commader_6.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_6.text: Her name is Vanra. She's seven years old, and has red hair - like me. We were in the Blushing Mermaid when she was taken - just up by the docks.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_45.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_45.text: No. Unless you count a couple of old drinking mates at the next table - but they'd be no help. They barely remember their own names.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_45.context: NodeContext: little too quick on the denial

MissingKidsMother_Commader_28.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_28.text: I was sober though, I swear. I stop in the 'Maid for a drink sometimes - but it was only a quick one!

MissingKidsMother_Commader_92.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_92.text: You must have some witnesses, surely.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_20.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_20.text: Of course - the front of house, Bosun Gannet was there, and the owner of the Blushing Mermaid, Captain Grisly.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_19.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_19.text: Neither lifted a finger to help me look - it was awful.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_18.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_18.text: I'll head to the Blushing Mermaid now.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_91.speaker: Lora
MissingKidsMother_Commader_91.text: Thank you. I'll head home - can't stand being around these idiots any longer. Come find me the moment you hear anything.
MissingKidsMother_Commader_91.context: NodeContext: disgusted at the words 'flaming fools' - sick of their shit. Pleading at the end

MissingKidsMother_Commader_58.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_58.text: Forget the Fists - tell me everything you know.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_21.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_21.text: I'm listening - tell me what happened.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_37.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_37.text: Excuse me, citizen, but if this is a criminal matter, it's my business. Not yours.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_61.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_61.text: Now, madam, if you'll just tell me why you're here, I'll take down the details.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_13.speaker: Player
MissingKidsMother_Commader_13.text: No - and it's not my problem.

MissingKidsMother_Commader_10.speaker: Blaze Liara Portyr
MissingKidsMother_Commader_10.text: Indeed - kindly leave this to the Flaming Fist. We have it under control.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_9.speaker: Narrator
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_9.text: *The execution of Florrick, convicted traitor and seditionist, has been delayed for an indeterminate time.*

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_18.speaker: Narrator
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_18.text: *Florrick, former advisor to Duke Ravengard, has been found guilty of treacherous and seditious activity against the people of Baldur's Gate.*

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_11.speaker: Narrator
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_11.text: *She will be executed by the light of tomorrow's sun.*

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_7.speaker: Narrator
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_7.text: *She will be executed two days hence.*

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_6.speaker: Narrator
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_6.text: *She will be executed three days hence.*

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_3.speaker: Narrator
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_3.text: *She will be executed four days hence.*

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_19.speaker: Narrator
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_19.text: *A scrawled note at the bottom reads: 'Vandalisation of official documentation is a crime. Kindly cease destroying these notices.'*

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_5.speaker: Lae'zel
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_5.text: Florrick's will be hanged. Unless you'd care to intervene.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_12.speaker: Shadowheart
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_12.text: Florrick's done for unless someone helps her soon.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_15.speaker: Astarion
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_15.text: Florrick's going to be hung?... Hanged?... Either way, it doesn't sound good.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_8.speaker: Wyll
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_8.text: Shit. Florrick's a true friend and ally - we can't let them hang her.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_14.speaker: Gale
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_14.text: Florrick's fate may not yet be sealed, if we care to intervene.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_4.speaker: Karlach
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_4.text: Florrick. We've got to help her.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_17.speaker: Halsin
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_17.text: A scaffold awaits Florrick. Perhaps we can free her.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_0.speaker: Jaheira
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_0.text: Florrick. The Fist would make an example of her - a shame if she were to mysteriously vanish from her cell.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_16.speaker: Minsc
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_16.text: Alas, poor Florrick... I have no idea who that is.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_1.text: I enjoy the spectacle of a hanging, but if our enemies accuse Florrick of treachery, she may be a useful ally.

FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_20.speaker: Narrator
FlorrickExecutionNoticeAD_20.text: *She will be executed five days hence.*
